update.description:
Another part of the ROCON work, due this week.

In this pull request:

1. Added Meta information to Visual protobuf messages.

1. Code to read meta information from SDF and add to visual messages.

1. Small change to `1208_world_plugin_init` to improve test stability. See [this build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-no-gpu/226/testReport/junit/(root)/Issue1208Test/Reset/)

1. Example world (`shapes_layers.world`) that uses visual meta information.

The graphical interface to layers is very minimal right now. Additional features (such as adding layers via the GUI) will be added in the near future.

[Nvidia clean](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/gazebo/job/gazebo-any-devel-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/174)
update.title: Use Meta information in SDF visuals in gzclient

content.raw:
Can we add something to `msgs_TEST.cc` for the new field? These new branches aren't covered:

* [VisualFromSDF coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/121/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_msgs/msgs_cc.html#816)
* [VisualToSDF coverage](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64/121/clover-report/_var_lib_jenkins_workspace_gazebo-any-coverage-trusty-amd64_gazebo_gazebo_msgs/msgs_cc.html#1047)
content.html:
Can we add something to msgs_TEST.cc for the new field? These new branches aren't covered:

  • VisualFromSDF coverage
  • VisualToSDF coverage

content.raw: Not necessary, but it would be nice to be able to name the layers. Numbers work well for floors in a building, but numbers aren't ideal for everything. Maybe they could be specified in the [gui block of a world file](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/d99cbe7b72e103275a34c75067740d43779085c2/sdf/1.5/gui.sdf?at=default)?
content.html: Not necessary, but it would be nice to be able to name the layers. Numbers work well for floors in a building, but numbers aren't ideal for everything. Maybe they could be specified in the gui block of a world file?
